metadata.title: CVE-2021-21702 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.27, 7.4.x below 7.4.15 and 8.0.x below8.0.2, when using SOAP extension to connect to a SOAP server, a maliciousSOAP server could return malformed XML data as a response that would causePHP to access a null pointer and thus cause a crash.

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
